I could have chosen to separate them, interpreting Łsāṃkhya$ as a stem form noun, because in other parts of the text, Łsāṃkhya$ and Łyoga$ are usually treated as two different traditions. See 8.1--3, 16.36--37 (here clearly separate), and 23.5c (again, clearly separate). In any case, one should probably understand Łpatañjalam$ as Łpātañjalaḥ$ metri causa, with gender confusion. Another, less likely, possibility is that Łsāṃkhyayoga$ and Łpātañjalayoga$ are somehow contrasted here.
